Source.Name: bc
Source.Summary: The GNU bc arbitrary precision calculator language
Source.Description: GNU bc is an interactive algebraic language with arbitrary precision which follows the POSIX 1003.2 draft standard, with several extensions including multi-character variable names, an `else' statement and full Boolean expressions

Package.Name: dc
Package.Summary: The GNU dc arbitrary precision reverse-polish calculator
Package.Description: GNU dc is a reverse-polish desk calculator which supports unlimited precision arithmetic. It also allows you to define and call macros. A reverse-polish calculator stores numbers on a stack. Entering a number pushes it on the stack. Arithmetic operations pop arguments off the stack and push the results.
